ygData.subject: Re: Restoring a deleted character
ygData.msgSnippet: We finally got a reply from a GM several hours later, and they gave us an email address to request the restore of the character. The one they gave was:
ygData.messageBody:
We finally got a reply from a GM several hours later, and they gave
us an email address to request the restore of the character.

The one they gave was: gms@...

Unfortunately it was undeliverable.

Does anyone have the correct email address please?

Thanks again!


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Tracy Fowler" <wareagletsf@a...>
wrote:
> yes it is stored on the eq server and not on the local machine
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: apcooper
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2003 7:55 AM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Restoring a deleted character
>
>
> Thank you very much indeed for your quick response :-)
>
> My son has used /petition to contact a gm and explained what
happened.
>
> Regarding patches - how often do these occur? The concern is that
the
> EQ autoloader downloads everything on startup. I assume that the
data
> with respect to each character are stored on the EQ server and no
the
> local PC?
>
> Thanks once again!
>
>
> --- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Tracy Fowler"
<wareagletsf@a...>
> wrote:
> > yes a deleted charature can be restored contact a gm in game
and
> explain what happened and it may take a while, you have to do it
> before the next patch, otherwise it cant be done
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: apcooper
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 27, 2003 7:44 AM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] Restoring a deleted character
> >
> >
> > Please help if you can!
> >
> > My son has just accidentally deleted his best character,
which he
> has
> > been working with for many months. Obviously he is most upset.
> >
> > Can the character be restored, and if so, what is the
procedure?
> >
> > Many thanks in anticipation!
